lines.content: * Represents the main class of the Lolo chatbot application.
* Responsible for initializing the application, handling user commands,
* and managing the flow of the program.
* Constructs a Lolo object with the specified file path.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and task list. If the task list
* cannot be loaded from the specified file, a new empty task list is created.
* @param filePath The file path to load tasks from.
* Continuously reads and executes user commands until the exit command is given.
* The main entry point of the Lolo application.
* Creates a new Lolo object and starts the application.
* Represents an exception specific to the Lolo application.
* This exception is thrown when the application encounters an error condition.
* Constructs a new LoloException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message for the exception.
* Handles the user interface for the Lolo application.
* Provides methods to read user input and display messages to the user.
* Constructs a new Ui object and initializes the scanner for reading user input.
* Reads a command from the user input.
* @return The command entered by the user.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm lolo.Lolo, your friendly task manager. 😊");
System.out.println("What do you want to do today?\n");
* Displays a line separator to the user.
* Displays the goodbye message to the user.
System.out.println("lolo.Lolo: Bye. Hope to see you again soon! 👋");
* Displays an error message indicating a problem loading tasks from the file.
* Displays a custom error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to be displayed.
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param size The total number of tasks in the list after the task was added.
public void showAddedTask(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + size + " task(s) in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
* @param size The total number of tasks in the list after the task was deleted.
public void showDeletedTask(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + size + " task(s) in the list.");
* Displays the list of tasks to the user.

* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays the list of tasks scheduled for a specific date.
* @param date The date for which tasks are being displayed.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks on the specified date.
public void showTasksOnDate(String date, TaskList tasks) {
System.out.println("    Here are the tasks on " + date + ":");
* Displays tasks that match the keyword.

* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* This command interacts with the user interface to confirm the addition
* and updates the storage with the new task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Executes the command by adding the task to the task list,
* displaying a confirmation message to the user, and saving
* the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws LoloException If there is an error during execution or saving.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LoloException {
* Represents an abstract command in the Lolo application.
* Commands define the actions that can be executed on the task list,
* and they interact with the user interface and storage components.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* This method must be implemented by subclasses to perform specific actions.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to read from or write to.
* @throws LoloException If there is an error during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LoloException;
* Indicates whether this command is an exit command.
* Subclasses can override this method to return true if the command should terminate the application.
* @return true if this command is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This command interacts with the user interface to confirm the deletion
* and updates the storage with the modified task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task number.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Executes the command by deleting the task from the task list,
* displaying a confirmation message to the user, and saving
* the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws LoloException If there is an error during execution or saving.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LoloException {
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* This command displays a farewell message to the user and
* signals that the application should terminate.
* Executes the command by displaying a goodbye message to the user.
* This command does not modify the task list or storage.
* @param tasks The list of tasks, which is not modified by this command.
* @param ui The user interface to display the goodbye message.
* @param storage The storage, which is not used by this command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command is an exit command.
* Subclasses can override this method to return true if the command should terminate the application.
* @return true, as this command is meant to exit the application.
* A command to find tasks by a keyword in their description.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LoloException {

* Represents a Deadline task in the Lolo application.
* A Deadline is a specific type of task that has a due date and time.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The due date and time of the Deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* The string includes a prefix "[D]", the status icon, the description, and the due date formatted as "MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a".
* @return The string representation of the Deadline task.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task formatted for saving to a file.
* The string includes the task type, status, description, and due date formatted as "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
* @return The data string representation of the Deadline task.

* @param from The start date and time of the Event task.

public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* @param description The description of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the status icon of the task.

* @return The status icon of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a string representation of the task.

* @return The string representation of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task formatted for saving to a file.

* Marks the task at the specified index as not done.

* @return The task that was marked as not done.
* Retrieves a list of tasks that are scheduled on the specified date.

* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.

* @param description The description of the ToDo task.

assertEquals(3, loadedTasks.size(), "There should be 3 tasks loaded.");
assertTrue(loadedTasks.get(0) instanceof ToDo, "First task should be of type ToDo.");
assertTrue(loadedTasks.get(1) instanceof Deadline, "Second task should be of type Deadline.");
assertTrue(loadedTasks.get(2) instanceof Event, "Third task should be of type Event.");

Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Sample Deadline", LocalDateTime.of(2024, 8, 29, 10, 0));

assertTrue(tasksOnDate.getTasks().contains(event), "Event should be included in the tasks on date.");
